questions.Entry-level Software Engineer: Can you describe a time when you had to solve a difficult problem during a project? What approach did you take, and what was the outcome?
questions.Team Lead: Tell me about a complex project challenge you faced as a leader. How did you navigate the problem-solving process with your team?

questions.Entry-level Software Engineer: Share an experience where you had to collaborate with others who had different skill sets or perspectives from yours. How did you ensure effective communication and teamwork?
questions.Team Lead: Describe a situation where you had to manage a conflict within your team. What strategies did you use to foster a collaborative environment?

questions.Entry-level Software Engineer: Recall a time when you had to learn a new tool or technology quickly for a project. How did you manage the learning curve?
questions.Team Lead: As a leader, how have you handled a sudden change in project direction or technology? What steps did you take to realign your team's focus and ensure continuity?

questions.Entry-level Software Engineer: How do you prioritize your tasks in a project with tight deadlines? Can you give an example of how you managed your workload effectively?
questions.Team Lead: Can you discuss a time when you had to oversee multiple projects simultaneously? What techniques did you employ to keep your team on track and the projects under control?

questions.Entry-level Software Engineer: Tell me about a project where you went above and beyond the basic requirements. What motivated you, and what was the impact of your initiative?
questions.Team Lead: Provide an example of how you encouraged innovation within your team. What was the challenge, and what role did your leadership play in fostering creativity?
